result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John W. Krings

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to WISCTF - Turned Over to CSA - Ck No 010656 - For Application to CSUP as to 2008FA000044

14CF-186, 15CF-43 and 15TR-413 - Both Cases Called @ 10:15 AM: Defendant John W. Krings in court with attorney Kirk William Everson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Minimum mandatory sentence explained with duration.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Agrees with 7 priors as recited by Court.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 (OWI 8):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Count 2 dismissed outright.  15CF-43 and 15TR-413 both DRI.  Counsel confirm Joint recommendation on sentencing.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Category of offense nullifies Def's opportunity to enroll in TAD Court.  Imposes 7 yr bifurcated term of imprisonment  - 3 yrs IC/4 yrs ES. 6 days of credit against SEH.  Conditions of ES: Ab Sob; Bar Prohibition; Not to possess/ingest any impairing substance unless prescribed by a physician; AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  $3500 Fine inclusive of Costs - bond from each case to be applied to financial obligations DNA surcharge to be attached - 60 DTP or PP - Bonds posted should cover entirely; 36 mos DL Rev/IID for 36 mos; OWI Assessment prior to any relicensing.  Eligible for SAP/Aged Ineligible for CIP.  Appeal Rights Given.  Def is immediately eligible for SAP to the extent available thru DOC.  Def requests that any add'l bond be turned over for CSUP.  $3500 posted to be applied first and then any balance that Def posted ($1500) and then be turned over for CSUP.   Bond revoked - Def remanded into custody.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case called @ 1:19 p.m. Defendant John W. Krings in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. ADA Anderson requesting $2000 Sig Bond. No statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $1500 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
